div.p: SHERBET, or Sherbit, a compound drink, firſt Brought into England from Turkey and Periia, conſiſtng of water, lemon juice, and ſugar, in which are dissolved perfumed cakes made of excellent Damaſcus fruit, containing an infuſion of some drops of rose water. Another kind of it is made of violets, honey, juice of raiſins, &c,
